translation: The Buddha then produced his feet and universally showed them to the assembly, and they all saw the wheel marks on the bottom of the Buddha's feet, which were elegant, well-appointed, and well-illustrated in style and principle, and they were clearly distinguished and unfailingly observed.

source_sentence: 王益歡喜，重白佛言：「不審世尊！
translation: The king rejoiced and repeatedly said to the Buddha, "I don't believe it, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 本作何德，而乃致此輪相之妙？」
translation: What virtues did the original work have that led to this marvelous aspect of the wheel?"

source_sentence: 佛即告王：「由我過去自修十善，復以教人，故得斯相明顯如是。」
translation: The Buddha then told the king, "Because I myself cultivated ten good qualities in the past and taught them to others, I have attained this distinctive appearance."

source_sentence: 王又白佛：「不審，世尊！
translation: The king then said to the Buddha, "I don't think so, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 自修十善，復以教人，其事云何？
translation: What are the ten good qualities that you yourself cultivate and then teach others?

source_sentence: 願見開示。」
translation: Please see it explained."

source_sentence: 佛告王曰：「善聽著心。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Listen well to those who are attached to mind.

source_sentence: 乃往無數阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有大國王，名施陀尼彌，領八萬四千國，八萬億聚落，一萬大臣。
translation: It's been countless incalculably long since this Jambudvīpa, and there was a great king named Śuddhodana, who ruled 84,000 countries, 800,000,000 villages, and 10,000 ministers.

source_sentence: 王有二萬夫人，皆無有子。
translation: The king had 20,000 wives, but none of them had any children.

source_sentence: 王甚憂愁，懼絕國嗣，即廣禱祀祈願諸天。
translation: The king was so distressed that he feared he'd lose the heir to his kingdom that he prayed and vowed to the gods.

source_sentence: 王第一夫人，名須梨波羅滿，經數時間，便覺有娠。
translation: The king's first wife, named Sūryaparamân, became pregnant after several lifetimes.

source_sentence: 自懷妊後，心性聰了，仁慈矜哀，勸人以善，日月滿足，生一男兒，端政超異，姿相顯美，身諸毛孔，皆有光明。
translation: After she became pregnant, she was wise and intelligent, kind and reserved, encouraging others to be good, and the sun and moon fulfilled their promise. She gave birth to a son whose appearance was outstanding and whose appearance was beautiful, and who had light in every pore of his body.

source_sentence: 王甚欣慶，覩之無厭。
translation: The king was delighted and never tired of seeing him.

source_sentence: 即召相師，占其吉不？
translation: He summoned a fortune teller to find out if he was lucky.

source_sentence: 相師披見，歎言：『奇哉！
translation: When the monk Phippii saw it, he praised it, saying, 'Amazing!

source_sentence: 是兒之相，挺特殊倫，德綏四域，天下敬戴。』
translation: 'This son's features are quite exceptional, his virtue pervades the four regions, and the world respects him.'

source_sentence: 王益歡喜，勅為立字。
translation: The king was delighted and ordered him to be given a name.

source_sentence: 相師白王：『有何異瑞？』
translation: The fortune teller said to the king, 'What's the extraordinary sign?'

source_sentence: 王言：『此兒懷妊已來，其母聰慧仁慈勸善，餘瑞雖眾甚怪此異。』
translation: The king said, 'Since this child was conceived, his mother's intelligence and kindness have encouraged goodness, even though there are many other signs that are quite strange.'

source_sentence: 相師驚喜，而白王言：『母豫辯慧，自身光明，當為立字名那波羅滿，晉言惠光。』
translation: The fortune teller was delighted and said to the king, 'His mother's intelligence and her own radiance will give him the name Nāpāramāṇa, which is the Jin dialect for Huiguang.'

source_sentence: 太子長大，智慧殊人，父王崩薨，葬送畢訖，諸王臣集勸令嗣位，太子固辭云不能當。
translation: When the crown prince grew up and had exceptional wisdom, his father died and was buried, and the king's ministers gathered to encourage him to take the throne, but the crown prince resisted, saying he couldn't do it.

source_sentence: 諸臣各曰：『大王已崩，唯有太子，更無兄弟。
translation: Each of the ministers said, 'The great king has died, and there's only the crown prince, and no brothers.

source_sentence: 今言不肯，推讓與誰？』
translation: Now that he says he won't, who will he give him the throne?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『世人行惡，必不執順，若加刑罰，罪我不少；若能率民普行十善，我乃堪任領受國事。』
translation: The prince answered, 'People who do evil will surely not follow it, and if they were punished, I would be less guilty; if I could lead the people to conduct the ten good deeds universally, then I would be fit to lead the affairs of the country.'

source_sentence: 諸臣言：『善！
translation: The ministers said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 唯願昇殿，十善之道，當勅令行。』
translation: 'May it please you to ascend to the palace, and I will command you to carry out the ten good qualities.'

source_sentence: 太子爾時，尋登王位，告下人民，普行十善，一切敬順，改心易操。
translation: The crown prince then ascended to the throne and told the people below to universally practice the ten good qualities, showing all respect and obedience and changing their minds to conduct themselves.

source_sentence: 魔王妬忌，欲敗王化，密作封書，告下諸國：『前勅行善，既無利驗，唐自勞苦，修無益事；自今以往，聽民恣心，作十惡事，勿更憚情。』
translation: The Māra king was jealous and wanted to defeat the king's influence, so he secretly wrote a letter to the lower kingdoms, saying, 'I've previously ordered you to do good deeds, but they weren't beneficial, so don't make yourself suffer and cultivate useless tasks; from now on, listen to the people's wilful intentions and do the ten bad deeds; don't be more compassionate.'

source_sentence: 諸王得書，怪此異詔，何緣越理，勸人從惡？
translation: When the kings received the document, they wondered why this strange edict had gone beyond reason and encouraged people to do evil.

source_sentence: 各遣親信，重問所由。
translation: Each of them sent a trusted friend to ask again about the reason.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，愕然驚曰：『我無是令，何緣乃爾？』
translation: When the king heard this, he was startled and said, 'I didn't order this, why is it so?'

source_sentence: 即勅嚴駕，躬行諸國，親見臣民，宣改異化。
translation: I commanded him to take him on a tour of the countries, meet his subjects, and proclaim his transformation.

source_sentence: 魔於道邊，化作一人，身處大火，盛炎熾燃，於中哭叫，聲悲酸切。
translation: At the edge of the road, Māra transformed into a man whose body was on fire, blazing hot, and in which he cried out with a sad, sorrowful voice.

source_sentence: 王即前問：『汝何以爾？』
translation: The king then went forward and asked, 'Why is that?'

source_sentence: 人白王言：『我坐前時勸人十善，今受此苦，痛毒難忍。』
translation: The man said to the king, 'I encouraged ten good qualities when I was sitting here, but now I'm suffering from this painful and unbearable pain.'

source_sentence: 王重答言：『何有是事？
translation: The king repeatedly replied, 'Is there such a thing?'

source_sentence: 勸人修善，反更受苦。』
translation: Encouraging someone to cultivate goodness leads to further suffering.'

source_sentence: 又復問言：『勸行十善，令汝受苦；前受勸人，行十善者，得善報不？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'Exhorting someone to do ten good deeds causes you to suffer; will someone who was previously encouraged to do ten good deeds obtain a good reward?'

source_sentence: 答言：『前人得善福耳，但教他故獨受此苦。』
translation: He replied, 'The person before us was well-merited, but we're teaching others to suffer alone because of this.'

source_sentence: 王聞歡喜答言：『但令前人得善福者，甘心受苦，不以為恨。』
translation: Rejoicing at what he heard, the king replied, 'Only let those who have attained good fortune in the past willingly suffer, and don't take it personally.'

source_sentence: 魔聞是語，即隱形去。
translation: When the Māra heard those words, he withdrew into hiding.

source_sentence: 遍行諸國，宣十善行，人民服化，慎身口意，正化彌布，一切欽崇。
translation: He traveled throughout his lands, proclaiming the ten good actions, teaching the people to be obedient and careful with their bodies, speech, and thoughts, and spreading righteousness and teaching, which were all highly esteemed.

source_sentence: 王德隆赫，嘉瑞而降，金輪先應，七寶具臻，遊化四域，導善為務。
translation: The king's virtue is so great that an auspicious omen descends, the golden wheel is answered first, the seven treasures are perfectly proportioned, and he travels to the four regions to guide goodness as his task.

source_sentence: 如是大王！
translation: Thus, great king!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時施陀尼彌王者，今現我父淨飯王是。
translation: "Would you like to know that at the time, King Gṛdhrakūṭa Nimi was, and now my father, King Jīvaka, is here?

source_sentence: 爾時母者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是。
translation: At the time, that mother was my mother, and now I'm Mahāmaya.

source_sentence: 彼惠光王十善化民者，今我身是。
translation: That King Huiguang's ten good qualities in transforming the people are now my body.

source_sentence: 我緣彼世自行十善，又以勸民令行十善，是以今日得是足下千輻相輪。」
translation: I conditioned myself on that world's ten good qualities and encouraged the people to do ten good deeds, so today I've attained the thousand-spoked wheel at my feet."

source_sentence: 時洴沙王，復白佛言：「六師群迷，不自度量，貪著利養，生嫉妬心，求與世尊捔試神力，言佛作一，我當作二。
translation: King Bimbisāra then again said to the Buddha, "The six teachers and their followers were deluded, didn't measure themselves, were greedy for profit, and became jealous, seeking to test the Bhagavān's powers by saying that the Buddha would make one and I would make two.

source_sentence: 佛現神變，妙難思議，六師窮縮，乃無一術，慚形愧影，投水而死，徒類散解，自遺殃患。
translation: The Buddha's miraculous powers are unfathomable, but the six teachers were so reduced that they didn't have a single skill, were ashamed of their forms and shadows, threw themselves into the water, and died, leaving their own misfortune behind as they were scattered and liberated.

source_sentence: 念其迷惑，何劇之甚？」
translation: How drastic is it to think of his delusion?"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「不但今日，六師之徒，諍名利故，求與我決，自喪失眾；過去世時，亦共我諍，我亦傷彼，奪其人眾。」
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Not only do the six teachers today seek to settle disputes with me over fame and profit, but they also lost their own people; in times past, they also fought with me, and I injured them and took away their multitudes."

source_sentence: 王即長跪，尋白佛言：「不審，世尊！
translation: The king then knelt down long and looked for the Buddha, saying, "I don't think so, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 過去世時，與六師鬪奪其徒眾，其事云何？
translation: In a past life, he fought with six masters and plundered their followers.

source_sentence: 願具說示。」
translation: Please explain it in detail."

source_sentence: 佛告王曰：「善著心聽。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Listen with good attention.

source_sentence: 乃往過去無數無量阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有一國王，名摩訶賒仇利，領五百小國王，有五百夫人，無有太子可以繼嗣。
translation: It was countless and incalculably long ago in this part of Jambudvīpa that there was a king named Mahācārya, who ruled 500 small states with 500 wives and no crown prince to succeed him.

source_sentence: 王自念言：『吾年轉大，無有一子以續國位，若其一旦崩亡之後，諸王臣民，不相承受，便當興兵抂害民命，國將亂矣，何苦之劇。』
translation: The king thought to himself, 'I've grown old and don't have a son to continue the throne; if the king's subjects don't bear up with each other once he collapses, they'll raise an army and harm the lives of the people, and the country will be in chaos; why would that be so painful?'

source_sentence: 念是事已，心沒憂海。
translation: After thinking about this, his mind sank into an ocean of grief.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋，遙知王憂，即從天下，化作一醫，來詣王所，問王憂意；王即如事，宣示語醫。
translation: Then, the god Indra, who was well aware of the king's grief, transformed into a physician from the whole world and came to the king to ask what he thought about his grief; the king then declared to the physician as it happened.

source_sentence: 化醫白王：『莫復憂慮！
translation: The magically conjured-up doctor told the king, 'Stop worrying!'

source_sentence: 我當為王，往入雪山，採合眾藥，與夫人服，服藥之後，皆當有娠。』
translation: I will be the king, and I will go into the snowy mountains and gather a combination of medicines for my wife to take; after taking them, she will all become pregnant.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，差用釋憂，即語醫言：『能爾者善。』
translation: When the king heard this, he was able to release his worries and told the doctor, 'Good, you'll be able to do that.'

source_sentence: 是時化醫，即往雪山，取諸藥草，擔還王宮，以乳煎之，與大夫人。
translation: The doctor then went to the snow-capped mountains, gathered the herbs, brought them back to the palace, decocted milk, and gave it to the eldest wife.

source_sentence: 夫人嫌臭，情又不信，化醫歸天，後不肯服；餘小夫人，盡共分服，服未經久，尋覺有娠。
translation: She disliked the smell and didn't believe the doctor, so he returned to heaven and refused to take it.

source_sentence: 各以情事白大夫人。
translation: Each of them told the first lady about their situation.

source_sentence: 夫人聞已，情乃憂悔，即問：『所服有餘殘不？』
translation: After she heard this, the lady was overcome with remorse and asked, 'Is there any residue left in what you've taken?'

source_sentence: 答言：『已盡。』
translation: He replied, 'It's all gone.'

source_sentence: 復問：『前草今者在不？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'Is the previous grass there now?'

source_sentence: 答言：『猶在。』
translation: He replied, 'It's still there.'

source_sentence: 尋勅取乳，更用重煎，持與夫人，夫人便服；服之數日，亦覺有娠。
translation: He asked me to get some milk, boiled it more heavily, and gave it to the wife, who then took it; after a few days of taking it, she also felt pregnant.

source_sentence: 諸小夫人，月滿各生，皆是男兒，端政殊異。
translation: The young ladies each gave birth to a male child at the end of the month, and their appearance was extraordinary.

source_sentence: 王見諸子，歡喜踊躍，悒遲念想於大夫人。
translation: The king rejoiced and jumped for joy when he saw his sons, and he thought long and hard about the eldest wife.

source_sentence: 夫人月滿，亦生一男，面貌極醜，形如株杌，父母見之，情不歡喜，因共號之為多羅睺施，晉言株杌，勅令養育。
translation: When the wife's months were up, she also gave birth to a boy whose face was extremely ugly and shaped like a stool. When his parents saw him, they weren't happy, so they all called him Tārāhosit, which is the old way of saying stool, and ordered him to be nurtured.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，其餘諸兄，皆已納娶，唯有株杌，不以在意。
translation: As he grew older, his other brothers had all married, but he didn't care about Zhuch.

source_sentence: 後會邊國，興兵入界，五百王子，領兵往拒，始戰軍敗，退來趣城。
translation: Later, they met a border state and raised an army to enter its border. 500 princes led the army to resist, but they were defeated in the first battle and retreated to their city.

source_sentence: 株杌王子，問諸兄言：『何以退走如恐怖狀？』
translation: Prince Zhuzhi asked his brothers, 'Why did he retreat in such a frightening manner?'

source_sentence: 兄輩語言：『往鬪不利，他軍見逐，是以走退。』
translation: The older generation said, 'We were not successful in the past fight, and other armies saw us being chased away, so we retreated.'

source_sentence: 株杌言曰：『如斯軍賊，敢見侵倰，取我先祖天寺之中大弓貝來，我欲往擊。』
translation: Zhu Di said, 'Such an army would dare to invade our region by taking a large bow and shell from my ancestor's temple in heaven, and I want to go fight them.'

source_sentence: 其先祖是轉輪王，即遣多人，往取舁來，而授與之。
translation: His ancestor, the wheel-turning king, sent many men to fetch the bow and give it to him.

translation: They took the bow and stretched it out, and when it sounded like thunder, the sound of the bow being struck was heard for 40 miles.

source_sentence: 到先吹貝，聲如霹靂，彼軍聞聲，驚怖散走，敵退乃還。
translation: When he arrived, he first blew a conch with a sound like a thunderbolt, and when the other soldiers heard it, they were frightened and scattered; the enemy retreated and returned.

source_sentence: 父王異遇，爾乃愛待，深思方便，欲為婚娶。
translation: He was so fond of this strange encounter with his father that he thought deeply about how to facilitate it and wanted to give him in marriage.

source_sentence: 「時一國王，名律師跋蹉，聞其有女，端政絕世，王即遣使，往告求婚，指其一兄貌狀示之，言為此兒，求索卿女。
translation: "It was then that a king named Rājagṛha heard that he had a daughter whose qualities were unmatched in the world, so he sent an envoy to ask for her hand in marriage, pointing out the appearance of one of his brothers and showing him, saying that he was asking for his son's daughter.

source_sentence: 使奉教到，具騰王辭，律師跋蹉，即許為婚。
translation: When the envoy arrived, he gave the king a detailed explanation and the lawyer, Vatsa, agreed to marry him.

source_sentence: 使還白王，王大歡喜，尋遣車馬，往迎將來，自勅株杌：『莫晝見婦，自今以後，常以日暮，乃見交會。』
translation: The messenger returned to the king, and he was greatly pleased. He sent chariots and horses to meet him in the future, saying, 'Don't see the woman by daylight; from now on, you'll always meet her at sunset.'

source_sentence: 時諸子婦，後共談語，各歎其夫種種才德。
translation: The sons and their wives then talked together, each praising her husband's various abilities.

source_sentence: 時株杌婦亦歎夫言：『我夫猛健力士之力，身又細軟，甚可敬愛。』
translation: The stūpa woman also praised her husband, saying, 'My husband is strong and powerful, a strong man, and his body is fine and flexible; he's very desirable.'

source_sentence: 餘婦語曰：『汝不須言，汝夫狀貌，正似株杌，若汝晝見，足使汝驚。』
translation: The other woman said, 'You needn't say anything; your husband's appearance is exactly like that of a stumpy beast; if you saw him in the daytime, he'd be enough to astonish you.'

source_sentence: 株杌婦聞，憶之在心，豫掩一燈，藏著屏處，伺夫臥訖，發燈來看，見其形體，甚用恐怖，即夜嚴駕，還至本國。
translation: When she heard that, she remembered it in her mind, hid herself in a screened-in place with a lamp, waited for her husband to finish lying down, then she gave him a lamp to look at his form.

source_sentence: 天明乃覺，甚用悒慼，捉弓持貝，尋跡逐往，到其國中，依一臣住。
translation: When morning dawned, he realized how distressed he was, grabbed a bow and a shell, retraced his steps, and drove off to one of his countries, where he stayed with a minister.

source_sentence: 「後六國王，聞律師跋蹉有絕妙之女，各貪欲得，興兵集眾，競共來索。
translation: "Subsequently, when the kings of six countries heard that Rājagṛha had a wonderful woman, they each coveted her, raised an army, and rallied their people to claim her.

source_sentence: 時律師跋蹉，甚用憒惱，令諸群臣博議其事：『正欲與一，其餘則恨；作何方便，却此兇敵？』
translation: Rājagṛha was so distressed that he had his ministers discuss the matter, saying, 'I was going to give one of them to them, but the others hate me; what's the way to get rid of this fierce enemy?'

source_sentence: 有一臣言：『當分此女，用作六分，一軍與一，其意可息。』
translation: A minister said, 'Suppose you divide this woman into six parts and give one to each army; his intention can be calmed.'

source_sentence: 或有臣言：『且出重募，有能却軍，以女妻之，分國共治，重加賞賜。』
translation: Some ministers said, 'Suppose you send out a heavy draft and have someone capable of refusing the army to marry your daughter, divide the country and rule it together, and give them a great reward.'

source_sentence: 王即然之，便行宣募。
translation: The king then agreed, and he proclaimed the need for troops.

source_sentence: 時多羅睺施即持弓貝，出城趣賊，吹貝叩弓，六軍驚駭，怖不能動，即入軍中，斬六王首，奪取冠飾，攝錄其眾。
translation: Tārāhosit then took a bow and shell, went out of the city to the bandits, blew the shell and struck his bow, and the six armies were terrified and unable to move.

source_sentence: 律師跋蹉，甚用歡喜，以女貢之，奉為大王，領攝七國，一切軍兵，將諸士眾，與婦還國。
translation: Rājagṛha was overjoyed and presented his daughter as his great king, taking charge of the seven kingdoms, all their armies, and their men, and returning them to the country with their wives.

source_sentence: 父王聞來，往出界迎，見子所領軍眾極盛，以國讓子，勸作大王。
translation: When the father king heard of his arrival, he went out to meet him at the border. Seeing the great army his son had led, he gave up his kingdom to him and urged him to become great king.

source_sentence: 其子不肯，云父猶在，理不應爾。
translation: His son refused, saying that his father was still here and he shouldn't have done it.

source_sentence: 「還到宮中，窮責其婦：『汝前何以夜棄我亡？』
translation: "He returned to the palace and severely rebuked his wife, saying, 'Why did you abandon me at night and leave me?'

source_sentence: 其婦答言：『君身極醜，初見驚怖，謂非是人。』
translation: The woman replied, 'Your body is so ugly that when I first saw it, I was frightened, thinking it wasn't a human being.'

source_sentence: 多羅睺施，捉鏡自照，乃見身首，熟似株杌，患厭其身，自不喜見，便至林間，乃欲自殺。
translation: Tārāhoṣa took a mirror and looked at himself, then he saw his body and head, ripe as a stool. Disillusioned with his body, he didn't like what he saw, so he went into the forest and wanted to kill himself.

source_sentence: 帝釋遙知，即下到邊，問所由緣。
translation: Tīrāhuṣṭhila knew this well, so he went down to the edge and asked about the reason.

source_sentence: 慰喻其意，與一寶珠，而告之言：『常以此珠，著汝頂上，可得殊異如我端政。』
translation: He explained his intentions, gave him a precious pearl, and told him, 'If you always put this pearl on your head, you'll attain a life as extraordinary as my own.'

source_sentence: 尋喜奉受，安其頂上，覺身倍異。
translation: He was delighted to accept it, placed it on his head, and felt himself doubly distinguished.

source_sentence: 還至宮中，自取弓貝，欲至外戲。
translation: He went back to the palace, took his own bow and shells, and wanted to play outside.

source_sentence: 婦見不識，尋語之曰：『汝是何人？
translation: When the woman saw it, she didn't recognize it, so he said, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 莫觸此物，我夫若來，儻相傷損。』
translation: Don't touch this thing; if my husband comes, he'll be hurt in a quite bad way.'

source_sentence: 尋語婦言：『我是汝夫。』
translation: The searcher said to the woman, 'I'm your husband.'

source_sentence: 婦殊不信，而語之言：『我夫極醜，汝形端正。
translation: She didn't believe him, but she said, 'My husband is extremely ugly, and your form is correct.

source_sentence: 汝是何人，說是我夫？』
translation: Who are you to say you're my husband?'

source_sentence: 夫即却珠，還示故形。
translation: The husband then removed the pearl and returned it to his old form.

source_sentence: 婦乃驚喜，云何乃爾？
translation: The woman was surprised and asked, "Why is that?

source_sentence: 夫即具悉，說得珠意。
translation: The husband then fully explained the meaning of the pearl he had obtained.

source_sentence: 婦自是後，敬愛其夫，株杌之名，從是滅除，便更稱之，名須陀羅扇。
translation: After that, the woman respected and adored her husband, and the name of the stump was thus removed, and she called it Sudarśana.

source_sentence: 「後自生念：『當率兵眾更起宮城。』
translation: "Then she gave rise to the thought, 'I'll lead the troops and build another palace.'

source_sentence: 即出觀行平博之處，勅諸人眾：『是中可作。』
translation: He then went out to observe the leveling of the river and commanded the people, 'This is the place to do it.'

source_sentence: 有四龍王，人形來問：『欲作城者，為用何物？』
translation: Then four dragon kings in human form came and asked, 'What would you use to build a city?'

source_sentence: 須陀羅扇言：『當用土作。』
translation: Sudarśana said, 'It will be made of clay.'

source_sentence: 龍復白言：『何不用寶。』
translation: Again, Nāgârjuna said, 'Why don't you use treasure?'

source_sentence: 答言：『城大，那得多寶？』
translation: He replied, 'The city is huge, so how much treasure could it be?'

source_sentence: 龍復白言：『我當相與。』
translation: Again, the dragon said, 'I will share this with you.'

source_sentence: 尋化四邊，作四大泉，而語之言：『用東泉水，而作塹者，便成琉璃；用南泉水，而作塹者，可成為金；用西泉水，而作塹者，可成為銀；用北泉水，而作塹者，可成頗梨。』
translation: He explored the four sides and made four large springs, saying, 'Use the eastern spring and make a moat, and it will become beryl; use the southern spring and make a moat, and it will become gold; use the western spring and make a moat, and it will become silver; use the northern spring and make a moat, and it will become a pārijāta.'

source_sentence: 尋時勅作，如語成寶，便令作城，方四百里。
translation: I then ordered them to make a city 400 miles square, just like the treasure they had said they would make.

source_sentence: 復勅作宮，方四十里，宮城街陌，樓觀舍宅，樹林浴池，悉是四寶嚴淨顯妙，略如天上。
translation: I also ordered a palace to be built, 40 miles in circumference, with its streets, buildings, mansions, forests, and baths, all of which are adorned with the four treasures that are pure and exquisite, just like those in heaven.

source_sentence: 宮城既竟，七寶來應，總攝四域，化民修善。
translation: When the palace was finished, the seven treasures came to respond, taking in the four regions and teaching the people to cultivate goodness.

source_sentence: 「如是大王！
translation: "Thus, great king!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時摩訶釋仇梨者，今現我父淨飯王是。
translation: "Would you like to know that Mahāśāsakauri was then, and now my father, the Śuddhodana King, is here?

source_sentence: 爾時母者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是。
translation: At the time, that mother was my mother, and now I'm Mahāmāyā.

source_sentence: 彼多羅睺施醜王子者，今我身是。
translation: That prince Tarahushka was now my body.

source_sentence: 彼時婦者，今瞿夷是。
translation: That woman, this is Ghoṣa.

source_sentence: 彼婦翁者，今摩訶迦葉是。
translation: That woman, the father, is now Mahākāśyapa.

source_sentence: 彼六國王欲以兵力逼求女者，今六師是。
translation: Those six kingdoms wanted to use their armies to force them to seek their women, and these are the six preceptors today.

source_sentence: 於彼世時，與我諍色，我傷害彼，奪取兵眾，乃至今日，嫉名利故，求與我試，無術稱心，投水而死，我攝徒類九億人眾，為我弟子。」
translation: In those days, they argued with me about form, and I harmed them by seizing their armies, up to the present day, when they were jealous of fame and profit and sought to test me.

source_sentence: 時洴沙王，復白佛言：「多羅睺施，本作何行，福德力強，形如是醜？」
translation: King Bimbisāra then again said to the Buddha, "Tārāhoṣa, what was it that you did in the past that was so virtuous and powerful that you took on such an ugly form?"

source_sentence: 佛復告王：「皆有因緣。
translation: The Buddha again told the king, "All of these things have their causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 乃往過去無量難計阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有一大國，名波羅[木*奈]，國有仙山，名曰律師。
translation: It was an incalculably long time ago in Jambudvīpa that there was a large country named [Pārā[muna*nai] and an immortal mountain called [Rājagṛha].

source_sentence: 時仙山中，有一辟支佛，身有風患，當須服油，至油師家，從其乞索。
translation: On that mountain, there was a pratyekabuddha who was suffering from a windstorm and needed oil, so he went to the oilgiver's house and begged for some.

source_sentence: 油師瞋恚，逆呵責之：『頭如株杌，手脚如軸，不肯生活候伺他家，不規錢買，但欲唐得。』
translation: The oil teacher was angry and rebuked him, saying, 'His head is like a stool, his hands and feet are like shafts, and he won't live to wait on others; he doesn't expect money to buy it, but wants to get it.'

source_sentence: 雖瞋呵責，然與油滓。
translation: Although he was angrily rebuked, he nevertheless gave them the dregs of oil.

source_sentence: 辟支佛心甚敬仰，受已適復擔去。
translation: Pratibhāna Buddha was so venerable that he accepted it and then took it away.

source_sentence: 其油師婦，從外而來，見辟支佛，心甚敬仰，問言：『快士！
translation: That oil teacher and his wife came from outside and, seeing the Padmaji Buddha, greatly admired him and asked, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 從何而來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 持此油滓，用作何等？』
translation: What will you do with the dregs of this oil?'

source_sentence: 時辟支佛如實語之。
translation: Prakaraṇa Buddha then told him the truth.

source_sentence: 婦便恨恨，還喚將來，即取其鉢與滿鉢油，怨責夫言：『汝實不是，云何乃以油滓與之？
translation: The woman then resented it, called him back, took his bowl and filled it with oil, and rebuked the husband, saying, 'You really aren't right; why did you give him the dregs of oil?'

source_sentence: 念還懺悔，除汝口過。』
translation: Remember and repent, and remove your verbal errors.'

source_sentence: 油師心悔，粗還辭謝，夫婦同心，白辟支佛：『若使須油，日日來取。』
translation: The oil-giver repented, returned with a cursory apology, and the couple, working together, said to Pṛthivī: 'If you need oil, come back every day to get it.'

source_sentence: 後辟支佛，數返取油，感其恩力，於油師前，現神足力，飛昇虛空，身出水火，分合身體，種種現變。
translation: Afterward, Pārśva returned several times to get the oil, and in response to his kindness, he showed up in front of the oiler with miraculous powers, soared up into the sky, escaped from the water and fire in his body, and combined his bodies in various manifestations.

source_sentence: 油師夫婦，見其神變，倍用歡喜，甚增敬仰，夫見是已，便語婦言：『汝所施油，當共同福受果報時，共為夫妻。』
translation: Seeing his miraculous transformation, the oil taker and his wife rejoiced and held in high esteem. When the husband saw this, he said to the wife, 'When you give oil, we'll be husband and wife together as we reap the rewards of mutual merit.'

source_sentence: 婦語夫言：『汝興惡言，向於快士，方施油滓，無有淨心，所生之處，當極醜惡，云何共汝作夫婦耶？』
translation: The woman said to the husband, 'You've spoken harshly, giving oil and dregs to a fastidious man who has no pure mind and whose place of birth will be extremely ugly, so how could we be husband and wife together?'

source_sentence: 夫復答言：『我常辛苦，積聚油具，云何獨施，不與我共？
translation: The man then replied, 'I've worked so hard to accumulate oil, why would I give it alone and not with me?'

source_sentence: 終不聽汝要作夫婦。』
translation: I'll never listen to your request to be husband and wife.'

source_sentence: 妻復言曰：『若為汝妻，見汝形醜夜棄汝亡。』
translation: The wife then said, 'If I were your wife, I'd abandon you at night when I saw your ugly form.'

source_sentence: 夫答之言：『正使汝亡，我當逐汝，要得乃止。』
translation: The husband answered, 'I will chase you away just so you'll perish, and then I'll stop when I get what I want.'

source_sentence: 夫妻語竟，向辟支佛，身心自歸，欵誠悔過。
translation: After they finished speaking, the couple went to Pṛthivī and returned to him with their bodies and minds, sincerely repenting their transgressions.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛語油師夫妻：『緣汝施油，我病得差。
translation: Pārśva then said to the oil-drinker couple, 'It's because you gave oil that my illness was healed.

source_sentence: 今汝夫妻，欲求何願？
translation: What do you and your wife want now?'

source_sentence: 恣汝所求，悉當令得。』
translation: 'Do whatever you ask, and you will receive it.'

source_sentence: 夫妻歡喜，長跪立願：『令我夫妻所生之處，天上人中，一切從意。』
translation: Rejoicing, the couple knelt down and vowed, 'Let's make the places where we're born as husband and wife, up in heaven and among humans, all agreeable to you.'

source_sentence: 如是大王！
translation: Thus, Great King!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時賣油人者，多羅睺施是。
translation: "You want to know that the oil seller at the time was Tārāhuṣṭhita.

source_sentence: 是時油師婦者，多羅睺施婦是。
translation: At the time, that oil vendor's wife was Tārāhoṣa's wife.

source_sentence: 緣於爾時見辟支佛，言似株杌手脚如軸，雖施油滓，瞋色與語，由是因緣，所生之處，初形甚醜，如前惡言；緣後懺悔喜施好油，所生之處，還得端正。
translation: It was then that he saw Pratibhāna Buddha, who said he resembled a stool with hands and feet like a shaft, and although he gave oil and dregs, his angry looks and words caused this to happen, and the place that he was born was initially ugly, just like the bad words before.

source_sentence: 緣以油施，常得多力，數千萬眾，無敢當者。
translation: As a result of this gift of oil, he always has so much power that tens of millions of people won't dare to accept it.

source_sentence: 福德報故，作轉輪王，食福四域，五欲從心，善惡之業，其報不朽。
translation: As a result of their merits, they'll become a wheel-turning king, eat well in four domains, subordinate their minds to the five desires, and have the results of good and bad actions that never die.

source_sentence: 是故一切，當念道要，慎身口意，遵修道行。」
translation: Therefore, all of you should remember the essentials of the path, be careful with your body, speech, and mind, and follow the course of cultivation."

source_sentence: 佛說是時，洴沙王等，諸王臣民，四輩之眾，天龍鬼神，聞佛所說，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，有種辟支佛善根本者，有發無上大道心者，或有遷住不退地者，一切歡喜，禮敬奉行。
translation: When the Buddha spoke this, the king of Bimbisāra and his subjects, the four groups of people, gods, dragons, and spirits who heard what he taught rejoiced, honored, and approved of those who had attained stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, non-returner, and arhat, those who had cultivated the good roots of the pratyekabuddhas, those who had arisen the mind for the unsurpassed great way, or those who had moved to the stage of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 賢愚經卷第二
translation: Sutra of Bhadraśriputra, Volume 2
